Description: Over thirty fragments of a golden brown, woven undyed flax tunic, fabric type L. The spinning direction of the warp and weft is 's' and the weave is plain and balanced. The thread count is 12-13 warp and 9-10 weft. A button loop is present made of four 's' spun and 'z' plied threads and two 'z' spun and 's' cabled threads. The underarm gusset is set squarely rather than angled and there are side gores in the skirt. The seams are very neat, flat fell seams and the hems are turned under. Flax thread was used and consists of 2 'z' spun and 'z' plied yarns. A wooden pin pierces one of the fragments.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.66, pl. 9c, 9D, 9E, 9F)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1. 128A (excavation object cat. no.)
